alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Livingston (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 10:47AM CST until January 28 at 10:30PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana... Amite River At Denham Springs affecting Livingston and East Baton Rouge Parishes. For the Amite And Comite Rivers...including Denham Springs...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Amite River at Denham Springs. * WHEN...From this morning to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Flooding will begin in the westernmost parts of Denham Springs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CST Saturday the stage was 29.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 24.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 29.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 29.5 feet on 02/02/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued this evening.late tonight at 500 AM CST.
